column4: hi, does anyone know how to enable direct3d support in virtualbox?
install guest additions
already done.. has no effect
did you edit xorg.conf to use the new driver?
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=777759
i only installed the guest additions
then the drivers are there, just not being used
dont expect miracles, direct3d isnt great
:) i only want to enable aero design for emulated win7
looks tacky if you ask me, like an afterthought
what means tacky?
plastic and cheap
you mean the whole aero design
yes, its also aero that means you must have a 3d gfx card just to run the desktop, its appauling
i know that it costs lot of performance.. but why dont use it when i have the ressources :), i like my jaunty to look like jaunty but i want my win to look like win in full gear :)
your choice. Id rather plow system resources into running apps better than some pathetic gloss
one thing in jaunty i have is that the windows open with some kind of delay, i dont know where this issue come from. when i had intrepid this problem wasnt there
run:  sudo lshw -C network     websearch for the product line to find guides. You can see if its already working with:  sudo iwlist scan | head -n 25     if you see wireless SSIDs then its working
run: rfkill list    to see if its blocked in any way
it doesn't show anything related to my wireless, the iwlist scan command, show me something about the lo and eth0
the rfkill list command did not output anything
